entry.title: Oauth2TechnicalUserPropagation in javascript
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I wanted to know what kind of configuration is needed to make an HTTP call with http/axios from SAP BTP CAP in NodeJS/javascript to an on-Premise system? I've tried with the Cloud SDK, but it does not support the Oauth2TechnicalUserPropagation  in the destination for HTTP calls (executeHttpRequest fails because of this).

I've tried making an axios call with the "SAP-Connectivity-Technical-Authentication" header, with proxy credentials that I can get from the destination, but that does not seem to work. So I wanted to know what was the full configuration needed to make a call with this setup to On-Premise system.

entry.title: Re: Extract S4 Raw tables with fields in excel

Hello @ishrath79 

You can use either SE16 or SE16N. The results can be displayed as ALV list that provides download to Excel function. Menu Settings -> User Parameters...

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: YTD Calculation in Restricted/Calculated Measure with...
entry.content:
Hey Alejandro,

to your questions:

There is a roadmap item for Q4 2025 regarding a ytd function for calculated measures in analytic models:


As of now, there does not seem to be a ytd function in analytic models.

Your approach with window function needs to include all dimensions in the "partition by" list to enable the drill on a more granular level. Alternative approaches you can also find in this blog post Running Year to Date (YTD) on fiscal periods with ... - SAP Community

Kind regards,

Tano

entry.title: CAP Deployment Stuck on "deploy-to-postgresql" ‚Äì GCP Subaccount (Frankfurt)
entry.content:
Hello CAP developers,

Since yesterday, I‚Äôve been unable to deploy a CAP application using PostgreSQL on SAP BTP. The deployment hangs at this step:

Executing task "deploy-to-postgresql" on application "name-of-app"

(Attached screenshot)

After this, the database doesn‚Äôt seem to work, and all CAP service calls fail.

Environment details:

  • Deployment method: cf deploy
  • Node.js: 20.19.3
  • npm: 11.4.1
  • CAP dependencies:
    "@cap-js-community/odata-v2-adapter": "^1.15.7",
"@cap-js/postgres": "^2.1.0",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "^4.0.2",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "^4.0.2",
"@sap/cds": "^9.5.1",
"@sap/eslint-plugin-cds": "^3.1.2",
"dayjs": "^1.11.13"
  • Dev dependencies:
    "@cap-js/cds-types": "^0.15.0",
"@cap-js/sqlite": "^2.0.1",
"@sap/cds-dk": "^9.5.0"
  • PostgreSQL setup: via SAP BTP
  • Subaccount provider: GCP (Google Cloud)
  • Region: Europe (Frankfurt)
  • Recent changes: None
  • Logs: No errors shown
  • Service bindings: PostgreSQL service instance is correctly bound to the app

entry.title: Certification - When will the testing format for the certifications change?
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a couple of questions regarding SAP S/4HANA certifications

  1. Upcoming changes to test formats
    Do you know when in 2026 the testing format for the following Sourcing and Procurement certifications is planned to change from theoretica to practical?

    • C_S4CPR ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì Implementation Consultant ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

    • C_TS452 ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

  2. Retirement of C_TS414 and possible replacement
    I noticed that the certification C_TS414 ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Quality Management is going to be retired.

    • Is there a plan to introduce a similar certification for Quality Management?

    • Is there any existing or upcoming certification you would recommend as a replacement or successor to C_TS414?

Thank you in advance for any clarification you can provide.

Anna

entry.title: Preliminary What‚Äôs New Information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602
entry.content:
Preliminary version of What‚Äôs New information and of the Product Assistance are now available for customers and partners to get a preview on the upcoming new and changed features of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602.

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal page SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (see What‚Äôs New section ‚ÄúPreview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602‚Äù). To access the Preliminary What‚Äôs New information, please use the What‚Äôs New Viewer or the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool.

The RASD tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What‚Äôs New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The preliminary information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 will be available in RASD within the next few days. We recommend using RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you. A valid S-User ID is needed to use the RASD tool and to view all the preliminary content stated above.

For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting Feature for What's New documentation in this release. See this blog for more information.

the Onboarding Token is created to help customers getting access in case the IT contact in the contract is not valid anymore or is not the right contact person. It is important to maintain the IT contact correctly to avoid delay in the provisioning process.

Hope it helps.

Best

Linh

entry.title: Integration of Health Care Professional (HCP) attendees to SAP Concur
entry.content:
Integration of Health Care Professional (HCP) attendees to SAP Concur
The primary purpose of HCP Attendee Integration is to automate and simplify the flow of HCP (Health Care Professionals) attendee master data into SAP Concur. This integration ensures that all attendee and event related data are accurate and up to date in the expense reports.

This integration is critical for industries (like pharmaceutical companies) wherein event-based expenses and HCP participant information must be recorded in the expense report.

Pre- Requisites:

  • Maintain Attendee fields mapping between SAP Concur and HCP Provider
  • Finalize Integration approach (Concur Web Services or API‚Äôs or any other approach)
  • Schedule Attendee import job if needed.

Configuration Steps for HCP Attendee Integration in SAP Concur

      1) Register/Configure Web Service Connector in SAP Concur

      Go to Administration > Company > Web Services > Manage Application Connectors        and enter into the required credentials shared by HCP vendor.

      
   
      

     Click Test Connection and then activate the Fetch Attendee Connector as shown                   below:

     

     
     2) Create the lists for HCP Attendees

           List Management:
          Depending on client‚Äôs requirement, Create the required lists under List Management to              capture attendee specific information.
      3) Customize Attendee Form
           Configure HCP Attendee Form under Forms and Fields according to client‚Äôs requirement
           and map the list created to capture attendee information to the relevant field (if                           applicable).

           

       4) Map HCP Attendee form to Health Care Professionals Attendee Type

             
      5) Configure data source (e.g., MedPro, Veeva Network).
      Uncheck ‚ÄúAllow users to add attendees of this type‚Äù to restrict manual entry (if
      needed). Click on ‚ÄúSave‚Äù

            
           Adjust the settings (Settings tab) according to the client requirement

           

     6) Activate the new HCP Attendee Type to the required Expense group.

         

Benefits of SAP Concur HCP Attendee Integration

  • Improved Data Accuracy and Consistency - Since attendee information is integrated directly into Concur from HCP data source, duplicate or incorrect attendee records are eliminated.
  • Automated and Scalable Data Sync - No more manual uploads: the integration handles continuous updates as new attendees are added or modified in HCP data source.
  • Streamlined Expense Management - Users can quickly select accurate attendee data while creating expense reports, saving time, and preventing errors.
  • Compliance and Audit Readiness - Since attendee details (e.g., customer, external guest) are documented correctly, compliance with internal policies and audit requirements becomes simpler.
  • Better Financial and Cost Tracking - Accurate attendee data ensures proper expense allocation and cost object management.
  • Enhanced User Experience ‚Äì Reduces Manual effort in capturing HCP attendee data in the expense reports

Conclusion

SAP Concur HCP Attendee Integration provides a powerful, automated solution for synchronizing attendee master data between SAP Concur and HCP Provider. By enabling accurate, real-time attendee details, organizations gets better control over event-related expenses which improves compliance and eliminate manual errors.

entry.title: Re: Tips and Tricks ‚Äì Time Valuations with next day combinations (working or non working day filters
entry.content:
hi @Vijey

This should be possible using time containers. I recently did this for a partner and it worked.

You need to create a dummy 1 min record for all days using "Create Time Record" Time Val type

And then use the above as input and filter those 1 minutes for days where its a non working day using filter input groups and filter as non working day. This should give you the time containers on non working days

Can you please try this and let me know if this works?

Regards

Neelesh

entry.title: Missing Statistical Currency (GRWCU) in PO ‚Äì Impacting Import Declaration in logiscts tab
entry.content:
While creating the inbound declaration, the statistical currency is missing in the Logistics tab.

Upon analysis, we found that the field GRWCU (Statistical Currency) in EKKO is blank for some POs. This causes the currency to be missing in the import declaration.

In several POs, GRWCU is updated automatically from the PO currency without any change log. But in some POs we see change logs where the statistical currency was modified manually.

We need clarification on:
1. How GRWCU is defaulted during PO creation in S/4HANA?


Can anyone please support on this issuse.

entry.title: Re: Cost center determination logic in Price difference w...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA, when a price difference (PRD) account like 52041000 is posted, the system does not inherit the profit center from the material master. Instead, it follows a hierarchical determination logic:

  1. Order/Project/CO assignment if available.

  2. Cost center from PO or GR if maintained.

  3. If neither exists, the system falls back to a default profit center defined in customizing (SSCUI 102639) or, if not maintained, to the company‚Äôs dummy profit center or organizational defaults.

entry.title: The Future of Supply Chain Management | Part 4 of 6
entry.content:
Supply Chain 2035: The Factory of the Future: Production in the Age of AI, Circular Economy, and Autonomous Systems

In the debate around the supply chain of the future, one aspect is taking center stage: production as the core of modern value creation for many companies. In times of global change, digital disruption, and growing demands for sustainability, it has a key role to play.

The production of the future is networked, flexible, and data driven. Leveraging technologies such as robotics, artificial intelligence, and the Internet of Things, it is increasingly growing together with other areas of the supply chain. This development is giving rise to a digital ecosystem in which real-time data availability enables faster and more accurate decision-making across the entire supply chain.

At the same time, production is gaining strategic importance: Companies are relocating manufacturing processes closer to sales markets to reduce their dependency on global disruptions ‚Äì a trend that has been further amplified by the pandemic, energy crisis, and geopolitical tensions. In addition, there is increasing regulatory pressure and simultaneous efforts to produce more sustainably and to use resources more efficiently. All of this must be achieved while maintaining the lowest possible production costs.

In short, production is not merely one element of the supply chain, but the driving force behind its future. It determines how resilient, climate-friendly, and innovative businesses can operate tomorrow. The fourth part of the study by SAP Business Consulting and K√ºhne Logistics University on ‚ÄúSupply Chain 2035‚Äù therefore focuses on production.

The result of the study clearly highlights that the vision of a connected, AI-powered, and sustainable factory has long since arrived in the minds of many manufacturing managers ‚Äì yet its implementation is still at the beginning in many places. There is a noticeable gap in maturity between the ambitions for 2035 and today's reality. While many organizations have already formulated a clear vision for the future, operational execution often remains fragmented and experimental.

The gap in sustainability and the circular economy is particularly striking. Circular production models and closed-loop material cycles are seen as key pillars of future value creation but are currently only implemented sporadically. Product designs that facilitate recycling, reuse, and modular construction are often still in the early stages of development.

Achieving digital continuity represents another major challenge. While connected, data-driven control is considered a prerequisite for the smart factory; data landscapes are often fragmented. The lack of interoperability and inconsistent standards makes it difficult to leverage production and supply chain information end-to-end.

Similarly, the deployment of artificial intelligence falls short of expectations. Many companies are experimenting with AI-powered applications, but the leap from pilot projects to widespread deployment is still pending. In addition, data quality and availability remain critical bottlenecks. Without clean, consistent, and connected data, every digital initiative remains piecemeal. It is only on this basis that intelligent systems can be scaled, and factories can be managed holistically.

In addition, organizational structures are undergoing transformation. Many companies are moving from experimentation to scaling ‚Äì a process that requires not only new technologies, but also new skills, structures, and leadership approaches. Transforming production therefore entails not just digitalization but a fundamental shift in the interaction between people, machines, and data.

The study underscores that while the path towards the factory of the future is charted, many pillars are still under construction. Success will depend on consistently linking technological and organizational building blocks. The factory of the future will not emerge from isolated innovations, but from the integrated interplay of data, technologies, and resource-efficient processes.

Figure 1: What the Data Really Shows ‚Äì Current Studies briefly

The factory of 2035 will differ fundamentally from what we are used to today. It is no longer a production system of siloed processes, but part of an intelligent, globally connected value-creating ecosystem. Data forms its central raw material ‚Äì flowing through all systems in real time, connecting design, manufacturing, logistics, and recycling to a dynamic and adaptive cycle. The decisions are increasingly taken by artificial intelligence. It controls material flows, optimizes production plans, and detects deviations and disruptions early and preventively. Human expertise will thus shift toward strategic, creative, and monitoring tasks ‚Äì AI becomes the central instance of production.

The physical factory itself becomes autonomous and modular. Production lines adapt in real time to changing orders, materials, or energy availability. Mobile robots, self-learning systems, and digital platforms orchestrate processes largely independently.

At the same time, the paradigm shifts from linear to circular production. Closed loops are emerging; products are designed in a modular manner and optimized for reuse or remanufacturing. Digital twins and IoT data connect the physical and digital worlds. Each manufacturing step, component, and usage generates data that makes the life cycle of a product fully traceable. This digital memory not only enables precise traceability, but also predictive maintenance, accurate material returns, and the continuous improvement of future product designs.

In summary: Industrial transformation is more than technological modernization ‚Äì it is a cultural change. The factory of 2035 becomes a reality where data intelligence and circular thinking become part of the company‚Äôs DNA ‚Äì not as an isolated project, but as a foundational principle. Those who actively shape this change not only strengthen their efficiency, but also their ability to reinvent themselves in an increasingly interconnected and dynamic industry.

 

This article was written in collaboration with Prof. Kai Hoberg (K√ºhne Logistics University) in the context of the SAP-KLU study "The Supply Chain of the Future‚Äù.

entry.title: Connect to Onprem LDAP Destination from CAP (Nodejs) App running in K8s cluster???
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have a requirement where we have to display users when a Cost Center value is entered.

We are looking to use LDAP protocol to fetch user details and have a working setup locally via ldap client

We have Kubernetes setup where we deploy our applications. We are looking for documentation/ gudance on how to connect to this on prem destination with SAP BTP connectivity service.

We use Transparent proxy, connectivity proxy intalled in the cluster and Destination and Connectivity services, cloud connector from BTP.

Though there is SAP help documentation, we dont have much clarity on how this can be done in CAP.

Looking forward for suggestions/support if someone has already implemented it.

We also interested in knowing if Default SAP IDP provides API's using which we can fetch the user data.

Thanks in Advance.

entry.title: Re: CO Periodic Activities Groups in the Budget Availabil...
entry.content:
Good day @suyoung_choi3 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you can do that but only by:

  • Creating a specific row for Activity Group 05 in the tolerance table and by.
  • Setting its message type to blank or using extremely high threshold values. 

This basically means, you cannot do it dynamically during execution but through configuration in the AVC profile.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Issue with Sending Email Notifications for PO Approval Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
I created a PO approval workflow and it works fine.
The client then requested email notifications for three cases:

  • PO approved

  • PO rejected

  • PO on hold

I configured Email Templates, the Notifications section in the workflow, and assigned the notifications to the relevant roles/users.
However, no emails are being sent.

Is there any additional configuration needed in CBC, or any prerequisite activation before workflow email notifications can work?

Any advice would be helpful.

entry.title: Release of SAP Disclosure Management Stack 2300
entry.content:
DM CLIENT 10.1

  • Customizable Queries
    With this new Stack, users can now create new and customizable queries for Sustainability Control Tower. This flexibility ensures that sustainability tracking can be tailored to the specific needs of your organization. Whether you focus on carbon emissions, resource consumption, or environmental compliance, customizable queries allow you to capture the exact data you need.
    The enhancements to the Sustainability Control Tower in DM mark a significant step forward in the integration of sustainability into business operations. With API access for data retrieval and the ability to create customizable queries, DM empowers users to take control of their sustainability programs, drive transparency, and achieve meaningful results.

XBRL TEMPL CREATION PLG 10.1

  • Boosting Creation Performance for Most Entry Points
    In today's fast-paced business environment, efficiency and speed are crucial for success. One of the key aspects of maintaining operational excellence is the ability to create and manage multiple entry points swiftly and reliably. With the release of DM Stack 2300, we are excited to introduce significant performance enhancements specifically designed to boost the creation process for most entry points.

  • Dynamic Gray Cells in Template Scenarios
    In the latest update to XBRL TEMPL CREATION PLG 10.1, we have introduced a significant enhancement aimed at improving user experience and data entry efficiency: dynamic gray cells in template scenarios. This feature ensures that cells in your templates are only grayed out when necessary, allowing you to enter data into as many dimension combinations as possible.

DM XBRL Mapper 10.1

  • Enhanced Context, Unit, and Dimension Mapping
    Previously, when working with contexts, units, and dimensions in Microsoft Word, users often found it challenging to keep track of which concepts these elements were being added to. This lack of visibility could lead to errors and inefficiencies, making the process more cumbersome and time-consuming.
    With the latest update to the XBRL Mapper, you can now instantly see in each tab which concept your contexts, units, and dimensions are being added to while working in Microsoft Word. Additionally, you have the ability to select and deselect these elements before finalizing your entries, ensuring precision and clarity.

entry.title: Re: EKKO-GRWCU field got changed during the debug but not...

entry.title: Re: EKKO-GRWCU field got changed during the debug but not...
entry.content: Hi @Vijayendra - I have the same issue ‚Äì the Statistical Currency is missing in the Import Declaration (Logistics Cost tab). Normally, it is picked automatically during the declaration, but for some POs we have to update it manually. Upon analysis, we found that the field GRWCU (Statistical Currency) in EKKO is blank for certain POs. Because of this, the currency is not picked automatically in the Import Declaration. How can we fix this issue?

entry.title: Re: Dates and Roundings in Compensation
entry.content:
HI ..

Can anyone help me with below requirement.

 

a. If the ‚ÄúHiring Date‚Äù  ‚â§ December 31, 2024, then ‚ÄúAB Pro-rata‚Äù = ‚ÄúAB Target‚Äù.

b. If instead the ‚ÄúHiring Date‚Äù > December 31, 2024, then ‚ÄúHiring Day‚Äù and ‚ÄúHiring Month‚Äù are considered, applying the formula
‚ÄúAB Pro-rata‚Äù = ‚ÄúAB Target‚Äù * (x/12) where:

  • x = (12 ‚Äì ‚ÄúHiring Month‚Äù + 1) if Hiring Day ‚â§ 15
  • x = (12 ‚Äì ‚ÄúHiring Month‚Äù) if Hiring Day > 15

    By way of example:
    ‚Ä¢ If the ‚ÄúHiring Date‚Äù  = December 30, 2024, then ‚ÄúAB Pro-rata‚Äù = ‚ÄúAB Target‚Äù.
    ‚Ä¢ If the ‚ÄúHiring Date‚Äù  = February 14, 2025, then ‚ÄúAB Pro-rata‚Äù = ‚ÄúAB Target‚Äù * (11/12), since ‚ÄúHiring Month‚Äù = February = 2, Hiring Day = 14 (‚â§ 15), and therefore x = (12 ‚Äì 2 + 1) = 11.
    ‚Ä¢ If the ‚ÄúHiring Date‚Äù  = May 18, 2025, then ‚ÄúAB Pro-rata‚Äù = ‚ÄúAB Target‚Äù * (7/12), since ‚ÄúHiring Month‚Äù = May = 5, Hiring Day = 18 (> 15), and therefore x = (12 ‚Äì 5) = 7.

entry.title: Re: SAP SSAM - Maps usage & Configuration
entry.content:
Hi,

Currently ESRi ArcGIS is the only supported map provider for SSAM out of the box.  
SSAM supports with Direct integration with ESRi or via the SAP GEF/ SAP Spatial Asset Management. 

The MAIF framework does allow to build your own integration if you wish to have a different map provider, note this is a complex development. 
The Product team is reviewing other map providers for a potential future feature.

entry.title: Re: delivery block at credit management in Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Dear @test4,

In Public Cloud can block delivery processing due to Credit Management, but it‚Äôs done via SAP Credit Management (FSCM) statuses/checks credit block, not via the classic SD simple credit check logic. When the credit check fails, the system can prevent delivery creation and/or later steps like picking and PGI, depending on how you configure it

That‚Äôs expected credit check types A/B/C (simple checks) are no longer available in SAP Credit Management for sales document types you can only use type D (Automatic) or leave it blank (no check)

So in CBC:

  • Set Credit Limit Checks for Sales Document Types (102137) only D is supported
  • Set Credit Limit Checks for Delivery Types (101707) you control which delivery types are checked and which credit group they use it does not mean A/B/C are available

More details below from SAP Note:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3367948

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3450345

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002900255

How to get a delivery block/credit block in Public Cloud

In CBC:

  1. Set Credit Limit Checks for Delivery Types (101707), assign the relevant delivery type to the credit group for:
    • Delivery (commonly credit group 02) and/or
    • Goods Issue / PGI (commonly credit group 03)
  2. Define Automatic Credit Control (101518), for your Credit Segment + Risk Class + Credit Group (02/03), activate the SAP Credit Management check and set the blocking behavior. This is what actually enforces blocking at delivery/PGI

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3674047

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002670121

Important Public Cloud behavior/limitation

If a delivery is credit blocked, the system can hard-stop Picking and PGI when exposure exceeds the limit and deliveries can‚Äôt be manually credit-released via Manage Documented Credit Decisions that app supports sales orders, not deliveries

More details below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003670434

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F5587')/S35

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003596276

https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-q-a/credit-check-is-not-working-for-delivery/qaq-p/13628903

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Posting a price difference with a variance account?
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please refer to the following information?

Invoice with Variances

Make settings in the configuration activity "Automatic Account Determination" (100297).

Account Determination

[Generative AI content] You can configure the system to post variances to specific accounts by setting up account determination rules. This involves configuring the account determination for variances using the above-mentioned configuration activity. 
If automatic posting to a variance account is not feasible, you might need to manually adjust the postings after the invoice is posted. This involves creating a journal entry to transfer the price difference from the account specified in the PO item to the desired variance account.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Incorrect name of company in ZENGINKYO payment media...
entry.content:
Good day @hyik 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3e5fcf2c768746049b5627bd5a42f720/8e71a76adeb84940b785936842cc7574.html?locale=en-US

The name of company you displayed in your screenshot is most likely pulled from your Central Business Configuration where Legal Entities was defined or Set Global Parameters for Company Code (SSCUI 100066). Even if you haven‚Äôt manually entered it elsewhere, the value was probably taken from the initial system setup.

Step 1: You can check what detail is configured in your system by going to Manage Your Solution App, then click Configure Your Solution. Use the search function to find Set Global Parameters for Company Code. Thereafter open th config activity, then review the Compan Name. That is what the system often displays in print forms or output.

Step 2: If you have Central Business Configuration active, then open the config environment, go to Define Legal Entities or Define Company Codes. Search for the Company Name, which syncs to S/4.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Credit Memo on Asset Triggers ‚ÄúNegative Acquisition Value‚Äù Error- Explanation requested
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I‚Äôd like to share an update regarding an issue I previously raised. When posting a credit memo on an asset in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the system triggers error messages about negative acquisition values‚Äîeven for very small amounts (e.g., 1 euro).

 

Context:

  • The asset is still in the first year of its useful life. (5years)

  • The asset class is ZMAT.

Temporary Solution Applied: Following community advice, we enabled the ‚ÄúNegative values allowed‚Äù option temporarily in the asset master data. This allowed us to successfully post the credit memo.

My Question:

Could you please help me understand the business rationale behind this behavior and the implications of applying this workaround? I am aware that enabling ‚ÄúNegative values allowed‚Äù is generally recommended for Assets under Construction (AuC), but does the same recommendation apply to fixed assets as well? In other words, is this workaround considered a best practice by SAP, or should we explore alternative configurations to prevent potential issues in reporting, compliance, or asset management in the future?

 

Thank you in advance for your insights!

FIN Asset Accounting  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Asset Management  SAP ERP

entry.title: Re: Are C_CPE and C_HAMOD right for my Java + spring boot...
entry.content:
Your plan is definitely on the right track. With 11 years of experience in Java Spring Boot and strong PL/SQL skills, moving to SAP BTP and HANA Cloud is a natural and smart progression. SAP promotes a clean core approach, meaning custom logic is added as side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP rather than modifying the ABAP core in ERP.

Starting with the C_CPE certification is ideal because it formalizes your current cloud-native app, security, and API skills in the SAP ecosystem using CAP, OAuth/XSUAA, and SAP Build Code. Your PL/SQL skills also translate well to HANA SQLScript and data modeling, making HANA Cloud essential for analytics and AI-positive future scenarios. To enhance your skills, aim to become an SAP BTP Extension Developer with a focus on Java and CAP, while also gaining knowledge in HANA Cloud for data and AI, and eventually learning SAP Integration Suite and Event Mesh for integrating real projects with S/4HANA.

entry.title: How to connect non-ABAP Products Built in On-Premises Environment to SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
We have built SAP HANA Cockpit, SAP IQ, and SAP SDI within our own Azure environment.
Is it possible to connect these products to SAP Cloud ALM and use features such as Health Monitoring?
If possible, please provide information on:

  • Connection method
  • Available features after connection



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to connect non-ABAP Products Built in On-Premises...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for reaching out with your query. Your case has reached the SAP Cloud ALM team.

Yes, it is possible to connect SAP HANA Cockpit, SAP IQ, and SAP SDI within your Azure environment to SAP Cloud ALM. Non-ABAP/non-SAP system data can be pushed into SAP Cloud ALM for operations use cases via the SAP Cloud ALM APIs.

This allows you to integrate and monitor these products within SAP Cloud ALM, including leveraging Health Monitoring.

 

Connection Method:

To integrate your systems, you can use the relevant SAP Cloud ALM APIs for pushing data. Specifically, the Raw Metrics, Raw Logs, and Raw Traces APIs will allow you to send operational data to SAP Cloud ALM.

 

Available Features:

Once connected, you can utilize various SAP Cloud ALM features, such as Health Monitoring, to monitor and manage the performance of your systems. The specific metrics and logs you can collect will depend on the data you push into the system.

 

For detailed information on how to integrate and utilize these features, I recommend referring to the following documentation:

  • SAP Cloud ALM Raw Data Inbound Metrics API
  • Raw Data Inbound Metrics API Documentation

These resources will provide more specific guidelines on how to configure the connection and the features available.

 

Kind Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Facing issues during Depreciation posting in SAP Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are facing an issue during the depreciation run where the system displays the error: ‚ÄúAccount assignment not available.‚Äù When we attempt to update the account assignment, another error appears: ‚ÄúPlease change account assignment objects in new time intervals.‚Äù

We understand this error occurs when postings already exist. Upon checking, we found that depreciation has been posted under Depreciation Area 15 for November with Journal Entry G000003452, but there are no postings under other depreciation areas.

Could you please guide us on:

Where is this G-series journal entry posted? and this entry cannot be reversed
How can we proceed to post depreciation for Depreciation Areas 01 and 34 for November?

Thank you for your support.

Thanks
Naveen Kumar

entry.title: Re: How to Enhance Sales Order Item Processing in SAP: Tabstrip UI + Popup Quantity Editing
entry.content:
I've been looking at this for some time now, and I have a hard time figuring out what its purpose is:

  • "Effective use of classic SAP GUI dialog programming" would be one, if it wasn't so full of bad programming practices (misused Hungarian notation, badly formatted source with inconsistent use of white space, magic numbers, no encapsulation of logic, cryptically named subroutines, ...)
  • "Clean user-driven quantity update process" eludes me - I can't see the part where anything is being updated
  • "Practical design for logistics screens" is also a miss, for a variety of reasons (layout includes tons of white space, buttons are loosely positioned without logic and too small with cryptical labels, ...).

Overall, while the effort of publishing code samples is commendable, this here mainly works as a bad example... Let's just hope that no AI will ever use this as a basis to generate code.

entry.title: Re: how to create multiple work orders at once in fieldgl...
entry.content: Based on the current SAP Fieldglass functionalities, there is no built-in way to create multiple work orders in batch/bulk without using the 'Work Order Request Import' functionality, which typically involves a CSV upload. This is the standard method for batch creation. If you need an alternative that avoids the CSV upload, it would require developing a custom integration using SAP Fieldglass APIs. This approach demands technical expertise to program a solution that interacts directly with the system for bulk work order creation. For more information on SAP Fieldglass integrations and APIs, you can refer to the SAP Help Portal (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_FIELDGLASS/20120120120120120120120120120120/12345678.html)

entry.title: SAP Neo Retires ‚Äì Integration Developers Must Know Before Migrating from Neo to CF
entry.content:
SAP has announced the end of maintenance for the SAP Cloud Integration Neo environment by December 31, 2028. This impacts customers running Cloud Integration on Neo and planning to move to the Cloud Foundry‚Äìbased SAP Integration Suite.

Migrating integration flows from Neo to Cloud Foundry is not a simple export/import of iflows.
Both environments differ significantly in:

  • Infrastructure
  • Adapter deployment
  • Logging & monitoring
  • Environment variables
  • APIs
  • Security materials
  • Transport & lifecycle management

This blog summarizes the key Neo vs. Cloud Foundry differences you must consider before starting your CPI migration.

1. Cloud Integration Availability: Neo vs. Cloud Foundry

Neo

  • CPI is available as a standalone product
  • Runs in SAP-managed data centers
  • Uses Neo cockpit & proprietary deployment mechanisms

Cloud Foundry

  • CPI is part of the SAP Integration Suite capability
  • Runs on hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Uses standard CF principles for scaling, service bindings, logging

üìåImportant: Some Neo features may not be available or behave differently in CF (refer to Note 2903776).

2. Adapter Deployment Differences

Neo

  • Custom adapters deployed using Eclipse plugin
  • Adapter artifacts managed in Neo cockpit

Cloud Foundry

  • Custom adapters are deployed as Integration Adapter artifacts
  • Managed via Cloud Integration Design & Monitor applications
  • Deployment uses CF-based lifecycle mechanisms

Impact:
If you have custom adapters built for Neo, they must be rebuilt or repackaged for Cloud Foundry. Here is the help document to create custom adapters Developing Customer Adapters

3. Logging Differences - Audit Logs & Access Logs

Neo

  • Audit logs retrieved via Neo Audit Log API
  • Access logs available under ‚ÄúAccess Logs‚Äù section

Cloud Foundry

  • Audit logs available through SAP Audit Log Service
  • Access logs integrated with Application Logs
  • Monitoring done via Cloud Integration Monitor

Impact:
Integrations relying on Neo-specific APIs must be redesigned for CF logging services. Here is the help document related to Audit logging in CF environment Audit Logging in CF 

4. Environment Variables - Critical Migration Topic

We can use environment variables in integration flows to address technical details like the region,port..etc where Cloud Integration is deployed.

The following table provides the mapping of environment variables in Neo and Cloud Foundry.

 

Variable Name - NeoVariable Name -CFDescription

HC_APPLICATION

Example value: abcd01iflmap

TENANT_NAME

Example value: xyz001

Sub domain of worker application (associated with application identifier for worker node)

HC_APPLICATION_URL

Example value: abcd01iflmap.uvwxy.eu1.hana.ondemand.com

TENANT_NAME + IT_SYSTEM_ID + IT_TENANT_UX_DOMAIN

Example value: xyz001.it-cpi001.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com

URL of the worker application sub domain

HC_HOST

Example value: hana.ondemand.com

IT_TENANT_UX_DOMAIN

Example value: cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com

Base URL of the SAP BTP region host where the application is deployed

HC_LOCAL_HTTP_PORT

Example value: 9001

PORT

Example value: 8080

HTTP port of the application bound to localhost

HC_OP_HTTP_PROXY_HOST

VCAP_SERVICES

Host of the HTTP Proxy for on-premise connectivity

HC_OP_HTTP_PROXY_PORT

Example value: 20003

VCAP_SERVICES

Example value: 20003

Port of the HTTP Proxy for on-premise connectivity

HC_REGION

Example value: EU_1

IT_TENANT_UX_DOMAIN

Example value: cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com

Region where the application is deployed

Here is the nice blog on how to call/get environment variable in CF Integration flows - identify-sap-cloud-integration-tenant-stage-at-runtime 

5. OData API Access Considerations

Neo

  • Uses Neo-based OAuth clients
  • API base URLs differ
  • Some OAuth grant types are Neo-specific

Cloud Foundry

  • Requires enabling API clients via XSUAA
  • Uses Integration Suite base URLs
  • Authentication flows must be updated

For example:
If you use CPI OData APIs for CI/CD, monitoring, or automation, the endpoints and tokens must be regenerated. Here is the help document gives more details on inbound communication setup - connection setup for inbound communication for api clients 

6. Transport Management & Lifecycle Changes

For the transport of integration content across different tenants, different options are available:

  • Manual export and import
  • Usage of CTS+
  • Usage of the cloud-based Transport Management

These options are identical independent of the environment (Cloud Foundry or Neo). However, setting up transport management using the cloud-based Transport Management service is different in both environments

7. Security Materials (Certificates, Keys, OAuth)

Neo

  • Keystore stored and managed directly inside Neo cockpit
  • OAuth clients created using Neo administration tools

Cloud Foundry

  • Uses Service Instances for trust stores
  • Certificates and keys must be re-imported
  • OAuth clients created via Integration Suite

Impact:
Rebuild all security configurations - especially if you use SFTP, AS2, OData, or SOAP with certificates.

8. Custom Scripting Adjustments (Groovy/JavaScript)

Some scripts refer to Neo-specific:

  • Endpoints
  • Log files
  • Environment variables
  • Adapter classes
  • Tenant metadata

These must be refactored to support CF equivalents.

9. Monitoring Experience Differences

Neo

  • Heavy reliance on Neo cockpit
  • Simplified logging UI
  • Access logs separate from application logs

CF

  • CPI Monitor in Integration Suite
  • Centralized message processing logs
  • Audit logging via SAP Audit Log Service
  • Better integrations with external monitoring tools

Impact:
Monitoring dashboards and alerting need reconfiguration.

Conclusion

Migrating SAP Cloud Integration from Neo to Cloud Foundry is a strategic, time-sensitive initiative as Neo retires in 2028. However, the migration is not a technical copy-paste.
Neo and Cloud Foundry differ significantly in:

  • Adapter deployment
  • Logging & audit mechanisms
  • Environment variables
  • OAuth & API access
  • Transport landscape
  • Runtime services
  • Security configuration

By understanding these environment-specific differences early - and adjusting integration flows, scripts, endpoints, and credentials accordingly - you can avoid migration failures, reduce manual fixes, and ensure a smooth transition to the SAP Integration Suite on Cloud Foundry.

If planned well, the Cloud Foundry environment offers:

  • Better scalability
  • CI/CD readiness
  • Modern logging and monitoring
  • Hyperscaler flexibility
  • Improved integration lifecycle governance

The best time to start preparing is now.

entry.title: Re: Custom Field Extensibility
entry.content:
Dear @Matt42,

That popup is the generic SAPUI5 Runtime Adaptation (Adapt UI) draft activation failed message it‚Äôs not specific to your custom field. SAP even has a Note for exactly this symptom which usually means the backend repository save/activate failed

SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003431777

Also step to check

1. Verify the custom field is really ready for this app

In Custom Fields app:

  • Field Status = Published
  • Business Context matches what the app can extend. For Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document (F0843) the extensibility help points to Material Document Item as the relevant area

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/df404e3e691f44eabd3fa2ee0412010d.html

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F0843')/S35

2. Discard the adaptation draft

In the Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document app:

  • Adapt UI
  • Go to Drafts/Versioning and Discard Draft
  • Close the app completely, reopen then re-do the change and activate again

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4fc8d03390c342da8a60f8ee387bca1a/b9de62a11b7941a08c549e0d4e196839.html

3. Make sure you‚Äôre adapting in the correct tenant in Public Cloud

In public edition, key-user extensions are expected to be created/collected in the customizing tenant of the DEV system, then moved via Export Software Collection / Import Collection
If you‚Äôre trying to activate in a tenant where key-user changes/transports are restricted activation may fail with this generic message.

4. If it still fails, capture the real error and raise an incydent to SAP

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: BOm component Validation
entry.content: I_RC29P-STLAL is always initial in PCSD0005 because SAP doesn‚Äôt fill it at that stage. Use RC29K-STLAL (global BOM header structure) or read from MAST/STKO to get the correct alternative BOM. This way, your validation will only compare components within the same alternative BOM, avoiding false duplicate errors across different alternatives.

entry.title: Is it possible to get journal entry async API confirmation in single payload?
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using below API to create all the required journal entries through single payload. This i am doing by splitting the node (JournalEntryCreateRequest) with number of journal entry needed.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b978f98fc5884ff2aeb10c8fdeb8a43b/22a267e571e948499fda007a65b27c64.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=2508.500&q=TAX+ACCOUNT

But, when the confirmation is getting generated it is sending separate confirmation payload by journal entry created rather than single payload with information of all journal entries created.

 

This was not the case before. can you please help in letting me know where would be the issue?

Thanks & regards

entry.title: Re: Clarification Needed on Revised Cost Appearing Higher...
entry.content:
Good day @rohini_dutta21 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f369b2eff700401494ba6e7c9a573288/e744f2b8eb23465fa93e058faed4aa99.html

Answer to question 1: The Revised Cost can become higher than the PO value when actual, accruals or estimated deviation are factored into the cost.

Answer to question 2: Yes, this behaviour is considered standard and it is linked to cost monitoring logic. SAP adjusts the value dynamically as more information becomes available.

Answer to question 3: For accuracy and to ensure alignment between Revised Cost and PO amounts, I recommend you regularly reconcile POs, invoices and actual costs, monitor your projects or cost centers (Actual/Plan/Commitment). Also review your Accrual Management Settings if you have enabled it and align GR/IR clearing and invoice timing.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris
